pull_request.title: Implement the publish of post-build status in bitbucket

pullrequest.title: Implement the publish of post-build status in bitbucket

content.raw: This is the dsl for the `ci-pr_any` jobs. Is there a reason why we don't put it in a more general file so that build status can be uploaded for jobs that test the release branches and default?
content.html: This is the dsl for the ci-pr_any jobs. Is there a reason why we don't put it in a more general file so that build status can be uploaded for jobs that test the release branches and default?

pull_request.title: Implement the publish of post-build status in bitbucket

update.description:
Tow main actions in this pull request:

  * Refactor the code than handles the set status so it can be called several times
  * jenkins DSL code to call status after build

I made some tests:

  *  [The testing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64_test_status_postbuild_tasks/). The last three builds are on different commits: success, failure or unstable.
  * The commits build results can be checked [here](https://bitbucket.org/_jrivero_/sdformat/commits/all)

If you want to play with a testing job that has this implementation, I just copy what the DSL generates here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64_test_pr_buildstatus
update.title: Implement the publish of post-build status in bitbucket
